title: Strengthening Instructional Practical Competencies: Medical Simulation-Based Teaching Competencies for Elementary Science Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain at least three cognitive/metacognitive strategies occurring in scientific problem-solving processes through medical simulation case analyses.
Learners can create a science experiment simulation lesson plan with no more than 10 steps applying the design principles (goal setting-execution-reflection) of simulation-based instruction.

Learners can diagnose the effectiveness (including self-regulated learning promotion and emotional management elements) of simulation education scenarios with over 80% accuracy using peer feedback and expert evaluation rubrics.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
